titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the W. F. Henderson papers, 1865

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters and documents concerning an equity case involving the purchase of cotton, submitted to the military authorities because of the lack of adequate civilian facilities.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: W. F. Henderson Papers, 1865, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: W. F. Henderson was a resident of Charlotte, Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters and documents concerning an equity case involving the purchase of cotton, submitted to the military authorities because of the lack of adequate civilian facilities.

controlaccess.subject: Cotton trade -- Confederate States of America
